bjhong02 writes:
> I've read message 841 and the article at
> http://www.dreamersrealm.net/tree/blog/2004/08/19.
> a hybrid method is proposed there to limite crawls to HTML.

The whole saga can be found at

http://www.dreamersrealm.net/tree/blog/heritrix/

which has some further notes not included in the 19 August post.

> I wonder if I can do the same thing by setting the Accept request-
> header field to text/html. according to HTTP protocol, if the server 
> cannot send a response which is acceptable according to the Accept 
> field value, then the server should send a 406 response.

Doesn't work... I tried it. I didn't experiment too much to figure out
the exact semantics as implemented by common servers, but it doesn't
do what you would expect.

> And if I can also set accept-charset, accept-language to limit the 
> crawls to specified resources.

Accept-Charset and Accept-Language are hints to the server used for
content negotiation. The reason to set them is to 'force' the server
to send content in your preferred language/encoding when it wants to
choose.
